allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add chat-based AI block editing in page editor

Add conversational block editing via a new "AI" tab in the page editor
sidebar. Users can select a block, describe changes in natural language,
and the AI updates the block content live using Claude''s tool_use pattern.

- Add chatEditBlockContent\(\) with update_block tool in ai-site-generator
- Add aiChatEditBlock\(\) server action with auth + site ownership checks
- Create BlockChat component with message bubbles, auto-scroll, per-block
  example prompts, loading state, and "Block updated" indicators
- Add AI tab to page editor with per-block chat history persistence

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Clean up repo: remove nul files, web/ leftover, screenshots/

- Remove Windows reserved ''nul'' files that snuck into the commit
- Remove web/ directory \(leftover from old single-app structure\)
- Remove screenshots/ from tracking
- Fix corrupted .gitignore and add nul + screenshots/ to ignore list

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Update ROADMAP and DESIGN_SYSTEM docs

- Add Sites & Page Builder section to ROADMAP \(visual block preview,
  AI chat editing, 13 block types, theme system\)
- Update Client Portal status in ROADMAP \(partially implemented\)
- Add Block Preview System section to DESIGN_SYSTEM \(architecture,
  key files, block types, CSS token system\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:/code/launchminds/ServiceOS" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add AI Archive Assistant chat side panel with visual file results

Bring back the AI chat panel in the file manager with clickable image
grids inside assistant messages, replacing the old wall-of-text output.
The server action now returns structured file data \(URLs, thumbnails\)
alongside text responses so the UI can render visual results.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:/code/launchminds/ServiceOS" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Update roadmap with File Manager and Blog Management modules

Add completed sections for the standalone media library \(Smart Search,
AI Archive Assistant chat panel, Freepik stock images\) and blog
management \(AI post generation, conversational editing, taxonomy\).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:/code/launchminds/ServiceOS" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Remove Smart Search and example prompts from file manager

Smart Search is redundant now that the AI Assistant chat panel handles
file search with visual results. Also remove example prompt suggestions
from the chat empty state to keep the UI focused on search for now.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
Bash(npx dotenv -e "C:\\code\\launchminds\\ServiceOS\\packages\\database\\.env" -- npx prisma db push --schema "C:\\code\\launchminds\\ServiceOS\\packages\\database\\prisma\\schema.prisma")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Migrate blog to organization-level with multi-site publishing

Move blog management from site-scoped \(/sites/[id]/blog/\) to a top-level
organization-scoped feature \(/blog/\). Blog posts, categories, and tags now
belong to the Organization instead of a Site. A new BlogPostPublication
join table enables publishing the same post to multiple sites.

Key changes:
- Schema: BlogPost/BlogCategory/BlogTag use organizationId instead of siteId
- New BlogPostPublication model for multi-site publishing
- New /blog admin routes with org-scoped server actions
- Publish/unpublish actions manage publication entries automatically
- Public blog queries through BlogPostPublication join table
- NovelEditor: add TipTap extensions \(StarterKit, Image, Link, Placeholder\)
- Handle legacy HTML content format in blog post editor
- Add file manager, media picker, and Freepik integration

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
Bash(cd /c/code/launchminds/ServiceOS/ServiceOS-web && npx prisma db seed --schema packages/database/prisma/schema.prisma 2>&1)
